t: Jeremiah 30
Deliverance from Captivity Promised
The*p word which came to Jeremiah from the Lord,*s saying,
“Thus says the Lord,*s the God of Israel, ‘Write all the words which I have spoken to you in a book.

For behold, days are coming,’ declares the Lord,*s ‘when I will restore the fortunes of My people Israel and Judah.’ The Lord*s says, ‘I will also bring them back to the land that I gave to their forefathers and they shall possess it.’ ”
Now*p these are the words which the Lord*s spoke concerning Israel and concerning Judah:
“For*p thus says the Lord,*s ‘I*pn have heard a sound of terror, Of*ln dread, and there is no peace.
Ask*ln now, and see If*ln a male can give birth. Why*ln do I see every man With*iln his hands on his loins, as a woman in childbirth? And*ln why*i have all faces turned pale?
Alas!*ln for that day is great, There*ln is none like it; And*ln it is the time of Jacob’s distress, But*ln he will be saved from it.
‘It*p shall come about on that day,’ declares the Lord*s of hosts, ‘that I will break his yoke from off their neck and will tear off their bonds; and strangers will no longer make them their slaves.
But they shall serve the Lord*s their God and David their king, whom I will raise up for them.

Fear*pn not, O Jacob My servant,’ declares the Lord,*s ‘And*ln do not be dismayed, O Israel; For*ln behold, I will save you from afar And*ln your offspring from the land of their captivity. And*ln Jacob will return and will be quiet and at ease, And*ln no one will make him afraid.

For*ln I am with you,’ declares the Lord,*s ‘to save you; For*ln I will destroy completely all the nations where I have scattered you, Only*ln I will not destroy you completely. But*ln I will chasten you justly And*ln will by no means leave you unpunished.’
“For*ln thus says the Lord,*s ‘Your*ln wound is incurable And*ln your injury is serious.
There*ln is no one to plead your cause; No*iln healing for your*i sore, No*ln recovery for you.

All*ln your lovers have forgotten you, They*ln do not seek you; For*ln I have wounded you with the wound of an enemy, With*ln the punishment of a cruel one, Because*ln your iniquity is great And*iln your sins are numerous.
Why*ln do you cry out over your injury? Your*ln pain is incurable. Because*ln your iniquity is great And*iln your sins are numerous, I*ln have done these things to you.

Therefore*ln all who devour you will be devoured; And*ln all your adversaries, every one of them, will go into captivity; And*ln those who plunder you will be for plunder, And*ln all who prey upon you I will give for prey.
For*ln I will restore you to health And*ln I will heal you of your wounds,’ declares the Lord,*s ‘Because*ln they have called you an outcast, saying: “It*ln is Zion; no one cares for her.” ’
Restoration of Jacob

“Thus*pn says the Lord,*s ‘Behold,*ln I will restore the fortunes of the tents of Jacob And*ln have compassion on his dwelling places; And*ln the city will be rebuilt on its ruin, And*ln the palace will stand on its rightful place.

From*ln them will proceed thanksgiving And*ln the voice of those who celebrate; And*ln I will multiply them and they will not be diminished; I*ln will also honor them and they will not be insignificant.
Their*ln children also will be as formerly, And*ln their congregation shall be established before Me; And*ln I will punish all their oppressors.

Their*ln leader shall be one of them, And*ln their ruler shall come forth from their midst; And*ln I will bring him near and he shall approach Me; For*ln who would dare to risk his life to approach Me?’ declares the Lord.*s
‘You*ln shall be My people, And*ln I will be your God.’ ”
Behold,*ln the tempest of the Lord!*s Wrath*ln has gone forth, A*ln sweeping tempest; It*ln will burst on the head of the wicked.
The*ln fierce anger of the Lord*s will not turn back Until*ln He has performed and until He has accomplished The*ln intent of His heart; In*ln the latter days you will understand this.
